charges.charge_description: 33:1319.F ENFORCEMENT-CRIMINAL PENALTIES: On or about 1993 through 2000, the exact dates being unknown, in Marcellus, NDNY, the deft did knowingly cause to be discharged pollutants from a point source into a water of the U.S. (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Sentencing: Deft appears with Atty Kevin E. McCormack, Esq. AUSA Craig Armstrong Bendict moves sentence. Judge Munson rules as to guideline applications and departs pursuant to Rule 11(e)(1)(c) binding plea agreement and advises deft of right to spea k. Deft's Atty speaks. Judge Munson, upon deft Darryl Meiers plea of guilty to Count 1 of the Information 00-CR-314, hereby orders the deft committed to the custody of the BOP to be imprisoned for a term of 1 YEAR AND 1 DAY. The Court recommends that the deft be designated to the BOP Community Corrections Center located in Rochester, NY. In lieu of restitution and as agreed to in the binding plea agreement the deft corporation is further ordered to make a charitable contribution of $2, 500.00 to the National Fish And Wildlife Foundation which is to be paid in full on or before December 21, 2001 with proof of payment to the US Attorney's Office and the US Probation Office. Upon release from imprisonment, the deft shall be place d on Supervised Release for a term of 1 YEAR and shall not commit another federal state or local crime. The Court has reliable information which indicates deft poses a low risk of future substance abuse, so the mandatory drug testing condition is sus pended. Deft shall comply with the standard conditions that he been adopted and the following special conditions: 1) The deft shall provide the Probation Officer, with any requested financial information. Special Assessment: $100.00. The Court n otes the Special Assessment was paid in full on August 1, 2001. The deft shall surrender to the BOP by reporting to the institution designated by 11:00am on February 1, 2002, as directed by the USMS.
